project_description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating the Cubit pattern for state management with a login and home screen.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular architecture with a clear separation of concerns. The lib directory is organized into folders for screens, cubits, models, and shared widgets. Each Cubit manages its own state and interacts with the UI widgets.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: The entry point of the application. Provides all necessary Cubits using BlocProvider.

methods.name: main
methods.description: The main function to run the app.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the widget tree with BlocProviders.

files.name: lib/screens/login/login_screen.dart
files.description: Defines the login screen with email and password fields.

files.name: lib/screens/login/login_cubit.dart
files.description: Manages the state of the login screen.

files.name: lib/screens/login/login_state.dart
files.description: Defines the various states of the login screen.

files.name: lib/screens/home/home_screen.dart
files.description: Defines the home screen with a logout button.

files.name: lib/screens/home/home_cubit.dart
files.description: Manages the state of the home screen.

files.name: lib/screens/home/home_state.dart
files.description: Defines the various states of the home screen.

files.name: lib/widgets/custom_button.dart
files.description: Defines a reusable custom button widget.

widgets.name: LoginScreen
widgets.description: A screen that allows users to log in with email and password.

widgets.name: HomeScreen
widgets.description: The main screen that users see after logging in, with a logout button.

cubits.name: LoginCubit
cubits.description: Manages the state and logic for the login screen.

cubits.name: HomeCubit
cubits.description: Manages the state and logic for the home screen.

models.name: User
models.description: Represents a user with email and password fields.

dependencies.name: flutter_bloc
dependencies.purpose: State management using the Cubit pattern.

dependencies.name: bloc_test
dependencies.purpose: Testing Cubit and Bloc state management.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> LoginScreen : Open
LoginScreen -> LoginCubit : Enter email and password
LoginCubit -> LoginState : Validate
LoginState -> LoginCubit : Success
LoginCubit -> HomeScreen : Navigate
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the Cubit pattern. Each screen has its own Cubit that handles the state and logic. The Cubit updates the state, which is then used by the UI components to display the appropriate information.
navigation_flow: The app starts with the LoginScreen. Upon successful login, the user is navigated to the HomeScreen. From the HomeScreen, the user can log out and be navigated back to the LoginScreen.

pubspec_yaml.name: simpleapp
pubspec_yaml.description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating the Cubit pattern.
